source_sentence: 佛說阿遬達經
translation: Foshuo anuttara jing

source_sentence: 宋天竺三藏求那跋陀羅譯
translation: Song Dynasty Translation of the Tripiṭaka of India, translated by Guanabhadra

source_sentence: 聞如是：佛在舍衛國，告諸比丘：「皆聽我所言致難，父母生子養育哺乳，
translation: Thus I heard: When the Buddha was staying in Sāvatthī, he told the monks, “They will all listen to my words and cause difficulties.

source_sentence: 長大欲令見日月光，父母以天下萬物示子，欲令知善惡。
translation: When he grew up, he wanted to let him see the light of the sun and moon, and his parents showed their children all the things in the world, wanting to make them know good and evil.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 如是子以一肩負父，復以一肩負母，至壽竟乃止，復以天珍寶、明月珠、玉璧、琉璃、珊瑚，
translation: In the same way, when a child carries his father on one shoulder and mother on the other shoulder, he does not rest until the end of his life. He also carries heavenly treasures, bright moon treasures, jade jewels, lapis lazuli gems, coral, and crystal [jewels] with his right shoulder.

source_sentence: 自生禽獸白珠，皆以著身上，尚未足報償父母恩。
translation: The white pearls of birds and animals that they produced themselves were all attached to their bodies, but they weren't enough to repay their parents' kindness.

source_sentence: 父母喜殺生，子能諫止父母，令不復殺生；
translation: When parents delight in killing, their children are able to admonish their parents so that they will not kill again.

source_sentence: 父母有惡心，子常諫止，令常念善無有惡心；
translation: A father and mother have bad thoughts in their minds, but the only thing they do is to admonish their children so that they will always think of them as good and not evil thoughts.

source_sentence: 父母愚癡少智不知經道，以佛經告之；
translation: His parents were ignorant and ignorant. They did not know the teaching of the scriptures, so they told them in Buddhist scriptures.

source_sentence: 父母貪狼嫉妬，子從順諫之；
translation: His parents were greedy and the wolf was jealous, and his children disciplined him.

source_sentence: 父母不知善惡，子稍以順告之。
translation: The parents didn't know what was good and bad, so the son told them to go along with it.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 子當如是。
translation: So it will be with you.

source_sentence: 為人作子，衣服欲好於父母，食欲甘於父母，語欲高父母上，至死後當入地獄中。
translation: Being a child for someone, they want their clothes to please their parents, food to please their parents, speech to exalt their parents, and will go into hell after death.

source_sentence: 為人作子，當孝順事父母，持行如是者，死當生天上。」
translation: Being a child for someone, you should serve your parents with filial piety, and if you do so, you'll be born in heaven when you die.

source_sentence: 諸比丘皆稽首，俱聞善教。
translation: The monks all bowed their heads and listened to the good teaching.

source_sentence: 佛言：「有大賢者優婆塞字遬達，為子取婦，婦字玉耶。
translation: The Buddha said, There was a great sage Upāsaka named Kauṇḍinya who took a wife for his son and the woman's name was Yueya.

source_sentence: 玉耶大豪富家女，不以姑妐之禮事遬達，亦不敬其夫婿積數年。
translation: The daughter of the great wealthy family of Yao didn't venerate Kauṇḍinya with an aunt, nor did she honor her husband and son-in-law for many years.

source_sentence: 遬達亦賢者優婆塞，不言不語，到佛所自責：『我為子取婦，國中豪富家子，
translation: Ānanda, the venerable layman Upāsaka Candracchattra had neither said a word nor spoken. He went to the Buddha and accused himself:

source_sentence: 心大歡喜。
translation: The mind is greatly joyous.

source_sentence: 今事我數年，憍慢自恣不以婦禮，願佛明日自屈到我家。』
translation: Now that you've been serving me for several years, you're arrogant and self-indulgent without paying your wife's respects, so may the Buddha bend over to my house tomorrow.'

source_sentence: 佛默然不應，默然不應者旦日欲往。
translation: The Buddha was silent and didn't respond, and those who were silent and didn't respond wanted to go there in the morning.

source_sentence: 明日佛到遬達家，其婦不出，佛以神化之，心喜，乃出見佛，前為佛作禮。
translation: When the Buddha arrived at Chanda’s house on the following day, his wife did not come out. The Buddha had miraculously transformed her and she was delighted. So he came out to see the Buddha and worshipped him in front of him.

source_sentence: 佛言：『汝為人作婦，用何事夫婿？』
translation: The Buddha said, 'For someone to become a wife for you, what's the use of your husband?'

source_sentence: 玉耶言：『當以身事夫。』
translation: Yao said, 'I will serve my husband with my body.'

source_sentence: 佛言：『婦人事夫有三惡四善。
translation: The Buddha said, 'Women and men have three bad and four good qualities.

source_sentence: 何等為三惡？
translation: What are the three evils?

source_sentence: 一惡者，如與惰人共居不欲作事，罵詈至暮，嗜美好鬪。
translation: One bad thing is like living together with a lazy person who doesn't want to do anything, scolds them until dusk and enjoys good fights.

source_sentence: 二惡者，如與怨家共居，不持一心向夫，不願夫善，不願夫成就，當願夫死。
translation: The second kind of evil is when someone lives together with an enemy and doesn't concentrate their mind on the husband, doesn't wish for his goodness, doesn't wish for his accomplishment, and should wish for his death.

source_sentence: 三惡者，如與偷盜共居，不惜夫物，但念欺夫，常欲自好，不順子孫，
translation: The third evil is that they live together with thieves and robbers. They do not cherish their husbands’ property but are only concerned with deceiving their husbands. They always wish for their own good but do not obey their children and grandchildren.

source_sentence: 但念婬泆。
translation: It's just mindfulness of anger.

source_sentence: 如是死者，展轉惡道中無有出時，是為三惡。
translation: These are the three evils of a person who dies like this, and there's no time to go out in a bad path.

source_sentence: 何等為四善？
translation: What are the four kinds of wholesomeness?

source_sentence: 一善者，婦見夫從外來，當如母見子，夫有急緩，常欲身代之。
translation: A good one is that when a woman sees her husband coming from outside, she's like a mother who sees her child, and the husband has an urgency and laziness, always wanting to replace him.

source_sentence: 二善者，婦事夫當如弟見兄，上下相承事，夫惡不以為惡，不念婬泆常隨夫語。
translation: The second is good: when a woman serves her husband, she'll be like a brother who sees his brother, and they'll serve each other up and down. When he's evil, he doesn't think of evil as evil, and he doesn't think of anger as always following the husband's words.

source_sentence: 三善者，婦事夫當如朋友，相見輒相念，夫從他方來，當如見父兄，心中歡喜和顏向之，
translation: The third good is that when a woman serves her husband, she should be like a friend. When they see each other, they will often think of each other. When the husband comes from another place, he should look upon his father and brother as if they were seeing one another.

source_sentence: 婦持心當如是。
translation: The woman's mind is maintained like this.

source_sentence: 四善者，婦事夫當如婢，夫大罵亦不以為惡，捶擊亦不以為劇，走使亦不以為勞苦，
translation: The fourth goodness is that a woman serves her husband as a maidservant, doesn't think of verbal abuse as bad, doesn't think of beating him as cruel, and doesn't think of walking messengers as painful.

source_sentence: 夫雖惡，常念事善，當顧子孫，如是死者常生天上，亦於天上饒侍者，
translation: Even if someone is evil, they should always be mindful of doing good deeds and looking after their children and grandchildren. Such a dead man will always be reborn in heaven; he will also provide for his attendants there.

source_sentence: 好衣、珍寶常在身上。』
translation: Good clothing and treasures are always on his body.'

source_sentence: 佛言：『三惡四善，汝欲持何所事夫？』
translation: The Buddha said, 'The three bad and four good, what do you want to serve?'

source_sentence: 玉耶言：『婦人事夫不可用三惡，四善者可與共居，從今以去，請如婢事大夫子。』
translation: Yao said, 'Women and men shouldn't use the three bad qualities or the four good qualities to live together with each other; from now on, they're invited to be like the maidservants who serve their husbands.'

source_sentence: 玉耶即膝行承事遬達，以夫婦之禮事其婿。」
translation: Yuya then knelt down to serve Candra and paid homage to his son-in-law with the rituals of a husband and wife.

source_sentence: 佛說阿遬達經
translation: Foshuo anuttara jing
